website_summaries.verdict: Superior durability, maneuverability, and comfort. The one to get if you want an option that handles almost as well as a hard-shell kayak.
pros: Built-in aluminum frame handles more like a hard-shell model
Material is durable and resists punctures
cons: Takes a while to dry out
Some owners find the drain plugs awkward to use

customer_reviews.title: ... this 4 times at the end of summer and loved it. Will be retired in 4 months so ...
customer_reviews.text: I used this 4 times at the end of summer and loved it. Will be retired in 4 months so plan to use it a ton next summer. Pretty easy to set up and take down. The only issue is trying to get it completely dry before storing. I keep trying new things and the next one is I am going to strap it to my roof with hold downs like a hard shell kayak and see if the travel home will get into the crevices and dry it out that way. I can live with it because its way easier than trying to load a hardshell onto a car roof by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: FRANK STEVENSON

customer_reviews.title: Great Kayak
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely great fast water boat. Just remember to open the scuppers. I forgot the first time and quickly learned the kayak is still maneuverable filled with water. Also, okay (not great) on flat water.
customer_reviews.author: TBom

customer_reviews.title: Very simply set-up
customer_reviews.text: This kayak is much sturdier than I had expected, and although I went slowly to air it up the first time (because it was all new to me), I was able to set up the kayak on the 2 and 3 trips in less than 5 minutes. I found it tracks easier and straighter than I had anticipated, and it is very comfortable as well, enough that I even took a small nap on my 2nd trip out to the bay. I recommend this, especially for smaller bodies of water and rivers. Customer service was very responsive by the way. I had read other reviews, and don't believe those to be true.
customer_reviews.author: patrick lynch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kayak
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed on how nice this kayak was very durable very comfortable you sit above the water you don’t sink in easy to maneuver and because it already has a self built tail in it you stay straight I love it I plan on buying more
customer_reviews.author: Cathy

customer_reviews.title: Inflatable canoe
customer_reviews.text: Fits in the trunk of my Miata. $10 high output pump from WalMart works fine. Handles fine. Yet one finds oneself on top of the water rather than in it. The seat is on a firm long tube elevated about 6 inches above the average kayak seat position. One of the great pleasures of kayaking for me is the sense of being "in" or a part of the water, without getting wet. This is closer to a canoe experience.
customer_reviews.author: KMAC

customer_reviews.title: Very narrow when inflated
customer_reviews.text: The springs in the inflation valves are very cheaply made. When inflated the space in the kayak is very narrow and seems unsafe. I went through Amazon to buy this but when returning the kayak to a company called Sportique I found that I had to pay a 20% re-stocking fee, as well as the price for returning the item, and that the product was actually made in Indonesia- it seemed from the website that it was an American made product.
customer_reviews.author: LB

customer_reviews.title: Great kayak!
customer_reviews.text: This is the very first inflatable kayak I've been on and I was a little worried as to how it would compare to the regular ones (I have kayaked in many different ones). I LOVE this one, almost even more so than the regular kayaks because it lets you go faster and is easier to maneuver, yet it doesn't feel like an inflatable kayak at all. Every time I'm on it I would get approached by someone asking if it's inflatable or real because it looks that sturdy. Money well spent!
customer_reviews.author: Alma H

customer_reviews.title: this boat has been great. We are boat people having owned many kayaks
customer_reviews.text: this boat has been great. We are boat people having owned many kayaks, canoes, sailboats in the past. This is perfect to carry on the plane to inflate at a far off destination. Tracks relatively straight. Seems durable. Had it in the pacific northwest, pulled up on rocky beaches, no problem. Very satisfied. I wish it came with safety air valves on the tubes as it does on the floor. That would make it perfect. Works great with one adult and a child as well as two children. If you are calm, you can paddle it and stay dry which is good if you are using it as a dinghy.
customer_reviews.author: Easy E

customer_reviews.title: Easily portable and inflatable
customer_reviews.text: I had been shopping for an inflatable - this one has done the trick! Easily portable and inflatable.The only negatives: It is a challenge to dry out before storing and not much cargo space.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Stone

customer_reviews.title: Great Inflatable kayak!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this kayak. I did a lot of research before I bought it. We have a two man inflatable that you sit down in. It is very stable. I was a little unsure how I would feel on this sit on top. It is very stable and very fun. We live in Hawaii and it perfect for me. I was also happy that Amazon shipped here at no charge. That is not always the case. Anyway I highly recommend this kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha Otani

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great yak for the price. Easy to inflate, deflate and store.
customer_reviews.author: Trailjunky

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the kayak one of the seems split. I’m hoping they will warranty it.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette N.

customer_reviews.title: Great inflateable Kyak
customer_reviews.text: Although I found other inflateable kayaks offered in stores or online, my friend owned this item and highly recommended it. It feels very sturdy for anyone of almost any weight. Tracks very well. The backrest could be a bit more supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Sigel

customer_reviews.title: Decent boat for the money
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get dry, hard to get into the bag. Decent boat for lazy rivers and small bodies of water.
customer_reviews.author: 911harley

customer_reviews.title: I use it in a bay only - very satisfied. It was a good buy 👍
customer_reviews.text: Tracks well, very rugged material. I use it in a bay only - very satisfied. It was a good buy 👍
customer_reviews.author: MONKEYWHOEEE

customer_reviews.title: Older kayaker
customer_reviews.text: Like the portability. Very good for me as an older kayaker as it is easy to get in and out of and very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome all around kayak!
customer_reviews.text: This kayak is great for anything you throw at it. It tracks just as well as my 10 foot hardshell in flatwater and ratad up"t class 3 whitewater. The seat is a little uncomfortable, but AE sells a more comfortable replacement. I love the fact that I can have it in my trunk when I get that urge to paddle. Inflates in about 5 minutes and is very stable and sturdy. Great boat!
customer_reviews.author: MediumB

customer_reviews.title: great product
customer_reviews.text: The kayak was very easy to set up and get into. After several hours of use i found it to be very stable. After use clean up was easy. The seat could be a little more comfortable
customer_reviews.author: uncensored

customer_reviews.title: & that was due to poor technique on my part
customer_reviews.text: I've had it about 5 weeks now, & have kayaked 5 sections of the N. Umpqua River in SW Oregon, totaling 31 miles. A few Class 4's, lots of C-3's & 2's. My very 1st day included two C-4's, & I stayed upright! I've only been swimming once, & that was due to poor technique on my part. My wife likes calmer waters, & has taken it out twice on more mellow sections; she gives it 5 stars also. It's only drawback for me is the less-than-ample legroom due to the airbag in front (I'm 6'-2"). I'll probably buy an AE "Attack" soon to solve the legroom, & my wife will use the StraitEdge.
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Ballard

customer_reviews.title: the material is very durable and the self draining system is really nice. you will never sink in this boat
customer_reviews.text: took this out on the reservoirs in park county CO. the material is very durable and the self draining system is really nice. you will never sink in this boat...awesome
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: but the one I got suffers from poor quality control - PROBLEMS RESOLVED
customer_reviews.text: It handles well and is well designed, but the one I got suffers from poor quality control. I have had numerous leaks,not from rough treatment or over inflation, not from being left out in the sun (in fact, I store mine inside in air conditioning), but apparently from poor quality control. I have had a number of leaks along the seams where it is very difficult to patch, to the point where I don't feel confident taking it down a river, since they happen out of the blue. I wish I could recommend this product but I can not.
customer_reviews.author: Spyglass

customer_reviews.title: love this kayak
customer_reviews.text: My sister gave me this kayak for Christmas last year. I love it. Very easy to maneuver in most water. I am a 63 year old woman and have no trouble carrying it or inflating with the double action hand pump I got with it. Of course its like any inflatable water toys you have in water, you have to let it dry before you store the keyak. I love it and just ordered one for my sister for Christmas. Cant wait to get back on the water.
customer_reviews.author: barwoods

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING inflatable kayak - period!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I can say anything that hasn't been said here before... this is a SOLID Kayak - one drawback is that advanced elements does not deliver the kayak with the backpack case... they send it in a shoulder-strap version which is cumbersome if you are hiking more than a half mile to the beach. Still, this inflatable allows me to kayak virtually anywhere!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schiemel

product_meta.title: ADVANCED ELEMENTS Strait Edge Inflatable Kayak
product_meta.description: The StraitEdge™ Kayak is the first sit-on-top self-bailing inflatable kayak to incorporate aluminum rib-frames in the bow and stern to improve tracking in open water conditions. With a hull design similar to a hard-shell sit-on-top kayak and self bailing ports that can be opened in rough conditions and closed in calm or cold conditions, you have a kayak that can be paddled in up to class III whitewater with improved trackability on open water. It can be easily packed away into its duffel bag and paddled in the most remote locations.
feature_bullets: Built-in aluminum ribs define the bow and stern and improves tracking
Set-up as self-bailing in bigger waves, and close ports in calm or cold water
Pre-assembled at the factory; simply unfold, inflate, and attach the seats
High support, adjustable padded seat provides comfort for hours of paddling
Heavy-duty PVC Tarpaulin material for extreme puncture resistance
